name: Residenza Johanna II

reviews.title: a little bit too far away
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights with my family.
The location was just a bit too out of the way.
reviews.title: Good, but the beds...

likes.liked: — Value for money, the lady at reception (and her dog!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It took a good 20-30 minutes to walk to
reviews.title: Adequate place

likes.liked: — Bath/shower and it was a far walk from main train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and breakfast were average.
reviews.title: Not a bad accomodation

likes.disliked: — Small bathroom and a little far from the attactions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After checking their web page photos it looked like a great deal. After ariving the real thing was quite different compared to the web photos. Good job on the web photos!!!! One room of the rooms is redocorated garage, but it is tasty though. However, the feeling is not the best one. No place to eat breakfast i.e. no dinning room so you have to improvise! Heavy eaters will stay hungry.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the web photos
Adequate
reviews.text: No credit cards accepted, but that was in the confirmation mail in advance.
Considering the alternative accomadations and rates it's OK.
reviews.title: A Pleasant Stay
No surprises!
reviews.text: We liked the quiet location and did not mind the walk, but I found the shower to be pretty dirty in the corners. Other than that, it was pleasant and we enjoyed our stay.

reviews.title: Unpleasant surprise
reviews.text: A nice, clean hotel with some homely touches. It is quite basic but comfortable. The only real disadvantages are the lack of air conditioning and the fact that it is about a 20 minute walk into the centre of Florence. The service was friendly and we would recommend this hotel to those wishing to see Florence on a budget.

description: This Residence is in a delightful villa dating back to the turn-of-the-century. There is private parking in the garden. The soothing pastel tints of the walls and fabrics lend light and grace to these comfortable rooms. The main Santa Maria Novella railway station and the Trade Fair and Convention Centre of the Fortezza da Basso are ten minutes walk away. The Duomo and most turistic sites are a 15 minute walk.
